brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts data stores and data servers analysis and compares client-server communication with server-server communication.

Network Topology:
Consists of three Access Layer switches: S1, S2, and S3. Each switch is connected to two Distribution Layer switches: D1 and D2. D1 and D2 are connected to Core Layer switch C1.

Client-Server Communication: The client is connected to S1, and the server is connected to S2. Packets from the client computer travel through S1, D1, and S2 to get to the server.

Server-Server Communication: Two servers and a data store are connected to S2. Packets from server to server and server to data store go through S2 only.
